publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1257 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive, in consultation with the Parliament, to establish a Commission of experts and lay persons to examine and report on social and medical factors which might require changes to be made to Scots Law and the working of the Scottish criminal justice system in relation to the use of cannabis in Scotland.
S1M-1257 Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System (lodged on 10 October 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-1257 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive, in consultation with the Parliament, to establish a Commission of experts and lay persons to examine and report on social and medical factors which might require changes to be made to Scots Law and the working of the Scottish criminal justice system in relation to the use of cannabis in Scotland. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1257 Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System (lodged on 10 October 2000) Christine Grahame*, Linda Fabiani*, Mr John Munro*
S1M-1257 Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System (lodged on 10 October 2000) Alex Neil*, Kate MacLean*, Margaret Smith*
S1M-1257 Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System (lodged on 10 October 2000) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1257 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive, in consultation with the Parliament, to establish a Commission of experts and lay persons to examine and report on social and medical factors which might require changes to be made to Scots Law and the working of the Scottish criminal justice system in relation to the use of cannabis in Scotland. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Mr John Munro, Alex Neil, Kate MacLean, Margaret Smith, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-1257 Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System (lodged on 10 October 2000) Scott Barrie*, Robert Brown*

S1M-1257 Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System (lodged on 10 October 2000) Ms Sandra White*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Mike Rumbles*, Michael Matheson*

S1M-1257 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive, in consultation with the Parliament, to establish a Commission of experts and lay persons to examine and report on social and medical factors which might require changes to be made to Scots Law and the working of the Scottish criminal justice system in relation to the use of cannabis in Scotland. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Mr John Munro, Alex Neil, Kate MacLean, Margaret Smith, Nora Radcliffe, Scott Barrie, Robert Brown, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Sandra White, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Mike Rumbles, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Euan Robson*, Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-1257 Ms Margo MacDonald: Cannabis and the Scottish Criminal Justice System-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive, in consultation with the Parliament, to establish a Commission of experts and lay persons to examine and report on social and medical factors which might require changes to be made to Scots Law and the working of the Scottish criminal justice system in relation to the use of cannabis in Scotland.
